data.title: Splat
data.statement:
You and your buddies are bored and decide to throw watermelons off high places onto the ground (<<Dont try this at home>>).
The watermelons are thrown <<perfectly horizontally>> at a velocity of [[V]] from a height of [[Y]].
You decided to calculate the <<time it took in seconds (t) - rounded to the nearest integer>>, and the <<horizontal distance (X)>> it travelled before hitting the ground in meters.

Useful formulas:
X = (Vx)*t
Y = (Vy)*t + (1/2)*9.81*(t^2)
<<*Vx is the initial horizontal velocity, Vy is the initial vertical velocity>>
data.constraints:
Y > 0
X >= 0
V >= 0
<<Use the rounded Time result when calculating the Horizontal Distance.>>
Ignore air resistance.
data.stubGenerator:
read V:int
read Y:int
write time
horizontal
data.inputDescription:
Initial Velocity in meters/second
Height from which the watermelon is released
data.outputDescription:
Travel Time (in seconds - <<rounded to the nearest integer>>)
Horizontal distance covered (in meters)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You and your buddies are bored and decide to throw watermelons off high places onto the ground (Dont try this at home).
The watermelons are thrown perfectly horizontally at a velocity of V from a height of Y.
You decided to calculate the time it took in seconds (t) - rounded to the nearest integer, and the horizontal distance (X) it travelled before hitting the ground in meters.

Useful formulas:
X = (Vx)*t
Y = (Vy)*t + (1/2)*9.81*(t^2)
*Vx is the initial horizontal velocity, Vy is the initial vertical velocity
Input
Initial Velocity in meters/second
Height from which the watermelon is released
Output
Travel Time (in seconds - rounded to the nearest integer)
Horizontal distance covered (in meters)
Constraints
Y > 0
X >= 0
V >= 0
Use the rounded Time result when calculating the Horizontal Distance.
Ignore air resistance.
Example
Input
0
20
Output
2
0
